meanings.sent1: After the storm damaged the church, the community came together to rededicate the building.
meanings.sent2: Every year, we rededicate ourselves to helping those in need by volunteering at the local shelter.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to rededicate their old car as a makeshift planter for their garden.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was rededicating her life to her passion for painting, starting fresh on a blank canvas.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's inspiring speech motivated the students to rededicate themselves to their studies.

meanings.definition: To commit or devote oneself anew.
meanings.sent1: After the setback, he knew he had to rededicate himself to his fitness goals.
meanings.sent2: She rededicated her time to learning a new language, determined to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to rededicate itself to catching the elusive red dot on the floor.
meanings.sent4: In the face of adversity, she found the strength to rededicate herself to her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The team captain's pep talk inspired everyone to rededicate themselves to winning the championship.

meanings.sent1: The couple decided to rededicate their wedding vows on their 25th anniversary.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers rededicated themselves to protecting their country, no matter the cost.
meanings.sent3: The mayor jokingly rededicated the town square to the local pigeons, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The artist felt compelled to rededicate her latest masterpiece to her late mentor.
meanings.sent5: The ancient temple was rededicated to the gods in a grand ceremony attended by all the villagers.
